word_forms.definition_en: able to notice very subtle things such as changes or differences that others may not be aware of

examples.example: Kelly is very sensitive to flavors. She can taste any food or drink and name it without seeing it.
examples.translate: Kelly對味道很敏感，不用看就知道吃了或喝了什麼。

word_forms.definition_en: highly advanced, referring to the five senses

examples.example: The owl has such a keen sense of hearing that it can hunt animals in the dark.
examples.translate: 貓頭鷹聽覺非常敏銳，所以可以在黑暗中獵食。

examples.example: Jamie is keen on making his classroom’s Facebook page the most interesting one in the school.
examples.translate: Jamie熱切地希望將班上的臉書專頁打造成全校最有趣的。

word_forms.definition_en: to find or be aware of something not easy to notice

examples.example: For most people, it is not easy to detect a small change in temperature.
examples.translate: 多數人不易察覺溫度的細微變化。

examples.example: More than half of the items in the clothing store were on sale for one day only.
examples.translate: 那間服飾店超過半數的品項有單日特價。

word_forms.definition_en: to complete a difficult task or reach a goal

examples.example: Albert respects those who have accomplished something great in their lives.
examples.translate: Albert尊敬那些在生活中成就卓越的人。

examples.example: Marc felt that leading his basketball team to the city final was his greatest accomplishment of the year.
examples.translate: Marc覺得帶領他的籃球隊挺進全市決賽是他今年最大的成就。

word_forms.definition_en: a human, animal, or plant sickness that is usually caused by an infection

examples.example: Washing your hands often is a good way to stop the spread of disease.
examples.translate: 常洗手是預防疾病傳染的好方法。

examples.example: Lynn’s grandmother is suffering from a serious heart disease, so she is staying in a hospital.
examples.translate: Lynn的祖母罹患嚴重的心臟病，現正住院中。

word_forms.definition_en: affected by or containing disease-causing bacteria

examples.example: Several passengers were found to have the disease after they took the same flight as an infected person.
examples.translate: 數位旅客在與感染者搭同一班飛機後也被發現患病了。

examples.example: More than 70 million people have been infected with AIDS in the last 50 years.
examples.translate: 過去五十年來，超過七千萬人感染愛滋病。

examples.example: The boy developed a serious infection on his leg because he didn’t clean the wound after he fell.
examples.translate: 這名小男孩跌倒後並未清理傷口，因此腿部出現了嚴重的感染。

examples.example: You shouldn’t rub your eyes because it can cause infection.
examples.translate: 你不能揉眼睛，因為這樣會導致感染。

word_forms.definition_en: to find a certain place, or the position of someone or something

examples.example: These days, most taxi drivers use GPS to locate places they don’t know how to drive to.
examples.translate: 現在，多數的計程車司機都用GPS找到他們不知道路的地方。

examples.example: This hotel is very expensive because it is in a good location right beside a beach.
examples.translate: 這間飯店很貴，因為就位在美麗海灘旁絕佳的地點。

word_forms.definition_en: something that is given to someone in recognition of a good deed or difficult task he or she has accomplished

examples.example: Janice was given a reward of $2,000 for informing the police of the address of the man they were searching for.
examples.translate: Janice告知警方他們追緝中的男子的地址，因此獲贈 2,000 元的賞金。

examples.example: Larry feels satisfied when he helps strangers, even if there is no reward.
examples.translate: Larry覺得幫助陌生人很有滿足感，就算沒有報酬也無妨。

examples.example: The teacher rewarded each of the students with a small prize after they all passed the exam.
examples.translate: 老師給每位學生小獎品，以獎勵他們考試全數及格。

word_forms.definition_en: the power to do a certain thing or a special thing that one can do

examples.example: Eagles have the ability to fly without landing for over three hours.
examples.translate: 老鷹有飛行超過三小時不需著地的能力。

word_forms.definition_en: to guess that something will happen at a future time

examples.example: The weatherperson predicted that it would start raining around 6:00 p.m., and she was correct.
examples.translate: 氣象人員預報晚上六點左右會開始下雨，果然沒錯。

word_forms.definition_zh: 設法成功做到；能夠應付
word_forms.definition_en: to put great effort into doing something and succeed

examples.example: Kyle managed to lose twenty pounds by exercising every day and eating less junk food.
examples.translate: Kyle靠著每天運動並且少吃垃圾食物成功瘦下 20 磅。

examples.example: Joey wasn’t sure that he could handle living abroad, but he managed quite well.
examples.translate: Joey不確定自己是否能適應國外生活，但他應付得相當不錯。

word_forms.definition_zh: 明智地使用、管理（金錢、時間等）

examples.example: Hailey’s parents told her that she should manage her money more carefully and stop wasting it.
examples.translate: Hailey的爸媽要她更小心用錢，不要亂花。

examples.example: For busy people like the president of a country, good time management is of great importance.
examples.translate: 對於一國總統這樣的忙人來說，良好的時間管理非常重要。

word_forms.definition_en: to cause something to come to be or to exist

examples.example: The inventor of the telephone, Antonio Meucci, created a new way for humans to communicate.
examples.translate: 電話的發明者Antonio Meucci創造了一種讓人類溝通的新方式。

examples.example: After the creation of the movie theater’s website, few people called to find out what movies were playing.
examples.translate: 在創建這個電影院的網站之後，很少人會打電話去查詢有什麼電影正在上映了。

examples.example: Nicole always has interesting new ideas, and she shows that in her creative paintings and drawings.
examples.translate: Nicole永遠都有有趣的新點子，也展現在她富含創意的畫作上。

examples.example: The students in the class showed great creativity in the wide range of topics they chose for their articles.
examples.translate: 這個班的學生們選擇的文章主題範圍相當廣，展現了十足的創意。

word_forms.definition_en: to let someone experience something or to introduce something to someone

examples.example: By reading these articles, students will be exposed to different opinions about the topic.
examples.translate: 通過閱讀這些文章，學生將會接觸到關於該主題不同的意見。

word_forms.definition_zh: 使暴露於；使遭受（危險或不快）

examples.example: It’s important to wear sunglasses on sunny days because your eyes could be injured if they are exposed for too long.
examples.translate: 晴天時戴太陽眼鏡是重要的，不然眼睛暴露在陽光下太久會受傷。

examples.example: Too much exposure to the sun and wind caused the paint on the building to come off.
examples.translate: 大量的風吹日曬造成大樓外牆油漆剝落。

word_forms.definition_en: to carry out an action, task, or duty

examples.example: After Mrs. Checknita fell ill, her family hired someone to help her perform daily tasks.
examples.translate: 在Checknita太太生病後，她的家人僱人來幫助她執行日常事務。

examples.example: Brad performed a song as a creative way to ask Jennifer to marry him.
examples.translate: Brad演唱了一首歌，當作向Jennifer求婚的創意方式。

examples.example: The band has practiced a lot, and this show will be the first time they perform on stage.
examples.translate: 這個樂團練了很久，這場表演是他們首次登臺表演。

examples.example: The magician will give a performance of his best tricks at the end of the evening show.
examples.translate: 今晚魔術秀的結尾，魔術師會表演他的拿手絕活。

word_forms.definition_en: the way a person or animal acts

examples.example: Animal behavior can tell us a lot about what a creature is thinking about or wants.
examples.translate: 動物行為可以讓我們清楚知道動物在想什麼或想要什麼。

examples.example: All the guests were impressed by how little Mandy behaved like an adult.
examples.translate: 所有的客人都對小Mandy大人般的行為留下深刻印象。

word_forms.definition_en: a warning that there may be some sort of danger or some special problem

examples.example: Everybody was asked to leave the mall due to a bomb alert in one of the stores.
examples.translate: 所有人都被要求離開購物中心，因為其中一間店有炸彈警示。

examples.example: The little beeps that your phone makes help you stay alert to new emails, messages, and posts.
examples.translate: 你的手機發出的小小嗶嗶聲會提醒你有新的郵件、訊息或貼文。

word_forms.definition_en: finished; entirely done

examples.example: The race is not complete until every runner from every team crosses the finish line.
examples.translate: 比賽要等到各隊的每位跑者都跨過終點線才算結束。

examples.example: In this English literature course, we will study the complete works of Shakespeare.
examples.translate: 在這門英國文學課程裡，我們將會研讀整套莎士比亞的作品。

examples.example: Kevin is an excellent student. He always completes school projects long before they are due.
examples.translate: Kevin是個優秀的學生，他總是於期限前的一大段時間，便完成學校的報告。

word_forms.definition_en: to give a special task or role to a certain person

examples.example: Craig was assigned the task of giving the new students a tour of the school.
examples.translate: Craig被指派一項帶著新學生校園導覽的任務。

examples.example: The students are going to Tainan on an assignment for history class.
examples.translate: 這些學生將到臺南做歷史課的作業。

word_forms.definition_en: relating to one certain thing

examples.example: There wasn’t any specific reason why Jason didn’t attend the performance with his friends. He just didn’t feel like it.
examples.translate: Jason沒有和朋友一起去觀賞演出並沒有什麼特別理由。他純粹是不想去罷了。

word_forms.definition_en: because of

examples.example: The restaurant was not very popular due to the smell of the seafood market nearby.
examples.translate: 這間餐廳因為附近生鮮市場令人作嘔的氣味而不太受歡迎。

word_forms.definition_en: quickly and unexpectedly

examples.example: Cindy was walking down the street when all of a sudden, rain began to pour down from the sky.
examples.translate: Cindy在街上走著，突然間從天上大雨傾盆而下。

word_forms.definition_en: to end in a certain way

examples.example: All the members of the band were worried about their performance, but it turned out to be amazing!
examples.translate: 所有的樂團成員都很擔心他們的演出，但結果很棒！

word_forms.definition_en: to find something or someone by chance

examples.example: Paulina went through all of her receipts but didn’t come across any winning numbers.
examples.translate: Paulina把所有的發票仔細看過一遍，都沒有發現任何中獎號碼。

word_forms.definition_en: to do and complete a task or an assignment

examples.example: After the statue went missing from the square, the police carried out an investigation.
examples.translate: 在雕像從廣場消失後，警方便進行調查。
